intro: Dissotis villosa, commonly known as the hairy dissotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Dissotis villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
